intro: Wikstroemia australis, commonly known as the New Zealand sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small shrub that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale blue or violet in color. It is well adapted to coastal conditions, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils. Wikstroemia australis plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
